info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 3:41PM EDT until August 14 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of southeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Brunswick and Columbus and northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Horry.
* WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 340 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. A Flash Flood Warning may be needed for any areas that receive enhanced rainfall amounts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Myrtle Beach, Conway, North Myrtle Beach, Sunset Beach, Holden Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Little River, Red Hill, Cherry Grove Inlet, Myrtle Beach Airport, Horry, Iredell, Carolina Shores, Tabor City, Loris, Calabash, Bethel, Hickory Grove and Goretown. - weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Brunswick, NC; Columbus, NC; Horry, SC
